page.title: 20Religion in Beckermet
page.content: As the village has grown and developed so the Church has flourished. Several different religions are represented by the inhabitants but the majority are either members of the Church of England or the Roman Catholic Church.It is thought the first church was built in 650A.D. on the site of St. Bridgets Church. The old St. Bridgets Church is still used for services, but the more modern church of St. Johns in the centre of the village is the main place of worship.There is also a flourishing Home Church where services are held in members' homes. There are close ties between the Church and the village school.The pupils attend services at the beginning and end of each term.They lead the Carol Services and Harvest Services attended by the whole community.
